DOC.HEAD: CBS News Producer Still Missing in Panama
With PM-Panama, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: The whereabouts of a CBS News producer who was seized with an ABC colleague by gunmen in Panama were unknown today, CBS said. ``Our efforts to find him have not stopped and will not stop until we can bring him back safely,'' CBS spokesman Tom Goodman said of Jon Meyersohn. The ABC producer, Robert Campos, 31, was freed Wednesday, nearly six hours after he was abducted. He told reporters he had been held in a Panamanian army intelligence headquarters where he was ``threatened, constantly.'' He and Meyersohn were among the journalists in Panama covering Wednesday's U.S. military strike there against Gen. Manuel Noriega. They were in the lobby of the Marriott Hotel in Panama City on Wednesday morning, discussing plans to send tape footage by satellite, when a group of armed men took them away, an ABC spokeswoman said. Meyersohn, 33, is a New York-based producer for the ``CBS Evening News.''
